author: sky.cactus
content: <@194433073394352129> https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/3236 didn't get noticed by the auto-merge bot, even after closing and re-opening the PR.  However, when I navigated to <https://ethlab-183014.appspot.com/merge/?repo=ethereum%2fEIPs&pr=3236> in my browser manually, it said `Merging PR 3236!` and then it merged.

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm not sure what triggers the bot to look at a PR, but that one didn't get looked at for some reason.  It was another "edit of PR in Review status" if that matters.

author: nickjohnson
content: That's probably the race condition - if it gets pinged before the build reports success to GitHub, it can't merge

author: sky.cactus
content: Hmm, it is a race between CI triggering the bot and CI triggering GitHub update?

author: nickjohnson
content: IIRC, there's no "build passed" GitHub webhook we can use

author: sky.cactus
content: Next time it happens I'll repeat the close/open process several times to see if I can get it to race correctly.
